intro: Oreobroma grayi, commonly known as the gray's mountainstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions, thriving in full sun. Its showy, blue to violet flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oreobroma grayi is adapted to arid environments and is often found in alpine or desert scrub habitats.
